instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight
threads.message:
Guys,

The motherboard is super clean. No water damage or something like that.
I get 49V on pin 1 (J8300) <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SO_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> i have new assembly 2015, however i don't have backlight.
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>: 3.42V
PRAM reset Done

Pictures:
[URL="https://www.dropbox.com/s/qahp8osfctlh1ep/IMG_2659.JPG?dl=0"]https://www.dropbox.com/s/qahp8osfct..._2659.JPG?dl=0[/URL]
[URL="https://www.dropbox.com/s/d9n7o9q5h7k623s/IMG_2661.JPG?dl=0"]https://www.dropbox.com/s/d9n7o9q5h7..._2661.JPG?dl=0[/URL]

Any idea?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight
threads.message: 49V means no load detected , you already tried new display assembly, so, bad display connector...... Plug a cable on the connector and check if there is continuity from pin 1 to the other end of the cable....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight
threads.message: I just tried another assembly from another mac and i get the same thing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight
threads.message: 49V means BKL circuit is working. Usually is a bad cable/connector/LCD.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight
threads.message:
Works!
Thank You Guys, I really appreciate your help!!!
